Problem:
Consider a control system represented by the linear differential equation \\(\\dot{x} = Mx + Nu\\), where \\(M\\) and \\(N\\) are constant matrices and \\(u(t)\\) represents a control input. Analyze the effects of applying the Laplace transform, denoted by \\(\\mathcal{L}\\), on this system.

If a new control protocol \\(u'(t)\\) is introduced as an intervention at a certain time \\(t_1\\), changing from the initial \\(u(t)\\), will the Laplace transform of the endpoint \\(x(T)\\) for T > t_1 be solely dependent on \\(M\\) and the initial \\(u(t)\\), ignoring \\(u'(t)\\)?
Explanation: The intervention with a new control protocol \\(u'(t)\\) modifies the input to the system which in turn changes the resulting Laplace transform of \\(x(t)\\), making it depend on both the characteristics of \\(u(t)\\) and \\(u'(t)\\), in addition to the dynamics defined by \\(M\\).
